definition: office/situation/classifier for games: match, set, round etc

sentences.english: Airlift tipped the balance of the sieges .
sentences.chinese: 空運扭轉了圍攻戰的戰局。

sentences.english: At present battle situation equitable the starting didn't musto long time.
sentences.chinese: 如今戰局纔開始未有太久的時間。

sentences.english: The third is about the people involved in the war situation and the times in the role of prophets.
sentences.chinese: 三是涉及對有關人物之於戰局和時勢作用的預言者。

sentences.english: This unexpected move serves to draw the black rook into the game.
sentences.chinese: 這步意想不到的招法將黑方的車投入戰局。

sentences.english: After Japan invaded China, she watched developments closely.
sentences.chinese: 日本侵華戰爭爆發後，她密切關注戰局發展。

sentences.english: The war situation was inverted and the invaders were defeated.
sentences.chinese: 戰局倒轉了，入侵者被擊退。

sentences.english: Onizuka in order to reverse the situation, at the expense of civilian hostages.
sentences.chinese: 鬼冢爲了扭轉戰局，不惜以平民爲人質。

sentences.english: Yammy's hand were recovered, now he participates in battle.
sentences.chinese: 牙密的手臂已經痊癒了，他現在加入戰局了。

sentences.english: When a bear jumps into the fight, Tod saves Copper and his owner.
sentences.chinese: 這時一隻熊跳進了戰局，陶德救下了庫珀和它的主人。

sentences.english: This game changing unit has the ability to teleport units and mind control.
sentences.chinese: 這個扭轉戰局的單位擁有傳送單位與心靈控制能力。

definition: to turn white-hot/to intensify/to reach a climax
could happen at any moment/on the verge
(of a pendulum) to stop swinging/(of work, production, activities etc) to come to a halt/to be suspended/to be canceled/shutdown/(sports) lockout
Lien Chan (1936-), Taiwanese politician, former vice-president and chairman of Guomintang
to oppose each other with equal harshness (idiom); tit for tat/measure for measure
to face an attack/to repulse the enemy
the state of play in an election/the current state of a candidate's campaign
to follow up a victory and press home the attack/to pursue retreating enemy
to glare like a tiger watching his prey (idiom)/to eye covetously
